reviews.review_msg: Dr. Clapps lectures made the material digestible. He is very knowledgeable and this gives him a great lecture style! His assignments are an expected workload and he makes what he wants very clear. His grading was quite fair and he gives plenty of comments and feedback. Dr. Clapp was also very accommodating and available when help was needed.

Alex is an amazing professor. He is super intelligent and you can tell he really knows his stuff. He's really interested and cares about the material he is teaching and he makes the classes fun. I've taken 2 classes with him and both went really well. He marks fairly and he's very understanding. Overall, he's pretty easy going and fun.

Excellent journal readings, writing feedback, interactive projects, and fair-minded way of presenting information. Lectures a bit of a laundry listing, but do show meaningful interrelationships, conflicts and issues.
Thought this class would be very interesting, but ended up being somewhat interesting. Personally didn't like his teaching style and the assignments. It is a "W"-course so expect the work load.

Alex taught me at the University of Toronto and I would say he is definitely one of the best profs I had whilst there...considering that it is a pretty top dog university that would make him among the best of the best. U of T clearly lost out when he moved out WEst (lucky for you though!)
Always great to take class with Alex! He is well organized and an interested professor. He has high standards, but will reward you for hard work.

alex makes you work for your grade, which is good if you plan to study this area further. TA Cecilia is hard ass on the marking but runs one of the the best tutorials I have ever taken. Whoever said he reminds them of tony blair, i hope you were talking about his looks not his approach!aj
Very well organized teacher. He is understanding and approachable. Class was much better than I expected it to be. Assignments are hard but very fair!

The assignments are hard, but the prof is helpful (funny too) and the lectures and slides are well organized. He tries to be objective about controversial topics, so you don't have to agree with him to get a good grade.

Be prepared to work hard.  Alex has many tiny assignments that really add up throughout the semester, however, they are the most practical you'll have ever write throughout your University career. Alex is also the chair of geography and has knack for hiring really cool, progressive sessionals.
He is very organized and helpful whenever you ask for help. His ta's are friendly and well versed in their knowledge. The material is extremely boring but he tries his best to make it less boring.
Great tree pictures, entertaining speaker. Manages to be sympathetic to carpenters and tree huggers too. The assignments are helpful for job market preparation.
Very knowledge.  But didn't learn too much from his lecture.  The course was easy though.  He brought his dog to lecture :>
Very clear good slide shows. You know what he is expecting from you for all assignments and exams. No midterms if you like that.
A Clapp reminds me of Tony Blair. His enthusiasm makes commodity markets worth the attention.

very nice and smart prof. it was a very helpful course.. I learned so many things and it was interesting!  you don't need to go to class, just get all the lecture tapes before the final and you can still get a good grade
He uses good slides in class, but he's disorganized and he needs to be more interactive.  Interesting material though.
Average teacher, nothing special. Has his favourites list. Interesting topics, but learnt nothing substantial.
Good teaching style- subject matter can get boring though. He does his best to keep things upbeat

Excellent Prof.  One of the best at SFU in my opinion.  Extremely knowledgable and enthusisastic about teaching.  Excellent organization and clarity.  Lots of notes and pretty interesting anecdotes.  You'll love him.
